result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah Suzanne Sether Coombs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation 
- 164 days against ultimate sentence
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

8:38 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: C. Dillon, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Sarah Suzanne Sether Coombs in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court for Sarah Suzanne Sether Coombs.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Ellenwood recites joint agreement.  Atty Davis agrees.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Forgery in 22CF331. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CF331. On motion of the State without objection, Crt read in and dismisses Ct 2 in 22CF331 for restitution purposes. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CF331

S/W 3 Years Probation 

- Court Costs: $268     
- DNA Surcharge: $250
- Restitution- $1600 to W. Coombs
Balance to be pd through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- DNA Sample
- Test randomly and regularly 
- Absolute sobriety
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- No Contact with W. Coombs
- Participate in MN Teen challenge program and complete successfully

Pre-trial conference on August 3, 2022 at 08:00 am.

- AMENDED 

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Wesley C.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random alcohol testing [or/and] random ETG testing at least 1 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

- I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
